When visiting Stamford, Texas, you’ll experience small-town, West Texas charm and a vibrant community spirit. Explore the town to discover local shops, a variety of local and chain restaurants, and historic sites. For a taste of the town's rich heritage, a visit to the Museum of the West Texas Frontier (open Friday-Saturday) is a must, offering insight into the area's cowboy culture and rodeo history. Nature enthusiasts can venture to the nearby Stamford Lake area for a peaceful day of fishing, picnicking, or simply enjoying the scenic views. Or catch a show at the historic Grand Theatre on the Square.

www.stamfordtx.org

The Museum of the West Texas Frontier serves as our town’s “official Visitor Center” welcoming travelers from all over to get to know our town. Plan a stop on your weekend visit to find out more about our local culture, get information about local businesses, and buy some memorabilia to help support our small town’s history.

113 South Wetherbee Street, Stamford, Texas 79553, United States

Call: 325-773-2500

westtexasfrontier@gmail.com

Friday - 10:00 am – 5:00 pm

Saturday - 10:00 am – 5:00 pm

  • Call 325-773-3344

  • The city of Stamford is quickly becoming a hub of country and western swing dancing. The as well as the historic l host regular dance events with some of the best western swing and country dance bands around. Visit and follow their Facebook pages for more info on upcoming events.

  • Harmon Park and Washington Park provide our community with places for kids to play as well as walking tracks and pavilions for community gatherings. For more information about reserving our park spaces, please call the city offices at 325-773-2723

  • Stamford is filled with various historical sites that will appeal to those interested in small town history and culture. You can see sites such as our Coke Park Mural just north of the square, the cowboy statue commemorating our western heritage heading west out of town, or the historic remains of the Stamford Inn built in 1900. Other notable sites include Arledge Field Airport and our Stamford Carnegie Library, both of which carry historical significance in our community.

Contact Us
